Here’s your complete trip summary based on Option B (Aman Tokyo for 10 nights at $500/night with 7 mid-range nights) for June 1–18, 2026.

Flight

Hotel and nightly rates

- Note: Kenji dinner and Toyosu Market bookings are not yet included in this total and will add modest amounts depending on choices

Key bookings to confirm

  - Option A: Auction viewing (5:30–7:30 am) + Outer Market breakfast
  - Option B: Outer Market visit only (9:00–11:00 am)

- Kyoto experiences (June 8, Kyoto stay Jun 7–9)
  - Cooking class: $95
  - Tea ceremony: $60
  - Times: Option A (cooking 9:30–12:00, tea 14:00–15:30) or Option B (tea 10:00–11:30, cooking 12:00–15:00)
- June 7–9 Shinkansen plan (Tokyo → Kyoto → Tokyo)
  - Outbound June 7, ~9:00–9:30 to Kyoto; return June 9, ~17:00–18:00 to Tokyo

Kenji details

- Phone: 090-8765-4321

If you’d like, I can lock in live quotes and finalize all bookings once you confirm these details.

Bruschetta (serves 6)

Ingredients:
- 12 San Marzano tomatoes, diced
- 6 cloves garlic, minced
- fresh basil, torn
- baguette, sliced
- olive oil
- balsamic vinegar

Instructions:
1) In a bowl, mix tomatoes, garlic, and basil. Drizzle with olive oil and balsamic vinegar; season with salt and pepper to taste.
2) Toast baguette slices until golden.
3) Spoon tomato mixture onto toasted slices and serve.

Salmon (serves 4)

Ingredients:
- 4 salmon fillets (8 oz each) [weight per fillet: 8 oz]
- 3 tablespoons butter
- lemon juice
- capers
- dill

Instructions:
1) Preheat oven to 400°F.
2) Place salmon on a baking sheet; dot with butter, drizzle with lemon juice, and top with capers and dill.
3) Bake 14 minutes, or until opaque and flaky. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

Roasted Asparagus (serves 4)

Ingredients:
- 1 bunch asparagus
- olive oil
- salt
- pepper

Instructions:
1) Preheat oven to 400°F.
2) Toss asparagus with olive oil, salt, and pepper.
3) Roast on a baking sheet for 15 minutes, until tender-crisp.

Tiramisu (serves 4)

Ingredients:
- 5 egg yolks
- 3/4 cup sugar
- 1 1/3 cups mascarpone
- 2.5 cups heavy cream
- 2 cups espresso
- 3 tablespoons coffee liqueur
- 30 ladyfingers

Instructions:
1) In a heatproof bowl, whisk yolks with sugar until pale and thick. (Optional: set over simmering water and heat to 160°F for safety, then cool.)
2) Beat in mascarpone until smooth.
3) In a separate bowl, whip heavy cream to stiff peaks; fold into mascarpone mixture.
4) Combine espresso and coffee liqueur in a shallow dish.
5) Quickly dip ladyfingers in the espresso mixture (1–2 seconds) and layer in a dish.
6) Spread a layer of the mascarpone cream, repeat dipping and layering, finishing with a top layer of cream.
7) Refrigerate at least 4 hours (or overnight). Dust with cocoa powder before serving.

Bruschetta (Appetizer) — Serves 6
Ingredients:
- San Marzano tomatoes: 12
- Garlic: 6 cloves
- Fresh basil: to taste
- Baguettes: 1 1/2
- Olive oil (for topping): about 3 tablespoons
- Olive oil (for brushing bread): plus extra
- Balsamic vinegar: to taste (start with 1–2 teaspoons)
- Salt and pepper: to taste

Steps:
1) Tomato topping: chop tomatoes, mince garlic, chop basil; mix with about 3 tablespoons olive oil; splash of balsamic; salt and pepper; rest 10–15 minutes.
2) Toast bread: preheat to 400°F (200°C); cut baguette into 1/2-inch rounds; brush with olive oil; toast 5–7 minutes until golden.
3) Assemble: top crostini with tomato mixture; drizzle lightly with balsamic if desired; serve.

Pan-Seared Salmon — Main
Serves: 4
Ingredients:
- Salmon fillets: 4 fillets
- Fillet size: 8 oz each
- Butter: 3 tablespoons
- Lemon juice: to taste
- Capers: to taste
- Fresh dill, chopped: to taste
- Salt and pepper: to taste

Steps:
1) Preheat oven to 400°F (204°C).
2) Pat salmon dry and season with salt and pepper.
3) In a large ovenproof skillet, melt 3 tablespoons butter over medium-high heat; sear fillets 1–2 minutes per side until golden.
4) Add lemon juice, capers, and dill; baste fish with melted butter.
5) Transfer skillet to the oven and bake for 14 minutes, until salmon is opaque and flakes easily.
6) Remove from oven, rest 2 minutes, then serve with pan sauce.

Roasted Asparagus — Side
Serves: 4
Ingredients:
- 1 bunch asparagus
- Olive oil: as needed
- Salt: to taste
- Pepper: to taste

Steps:
1) Preheat oven to 425°F (218°C).
2) Trim ends of asparagus.
3) Toss with olive oil, salt, and pepper.
4) Roast on a baking sheet in a single layer for 15 minutes, until tender and slightly crisp.

Tiramisu — Dessert
Serves: 4
Ingredients:
- Egg yolks: 5
- Sugar: 3/4 cup
- Mascarpone: 1 1/3 cups
- Heavy cream: 2.5 cups
- Espresso: 2 cups
- Coffee liqueur: 3 tablespoons
- Ladyfingers: 30
- Cocoa powder: for dusting (optional)
- Pasteurized eggs: can be used (note)

Steps:
1) Whisk yolks and sugar over simmering water until thick and pale; remove from heat.
2) Whisk in mascarpone until smooth.
3) Whip heavy cream to soft peaks; fold into mascarpone mixture.
4) Combine espresso and coffee liqueur in a shallow dish.
5) Dip ladyfingers briefly (1–2 seconds) and layer on a dish.
6) Spread half the mascarpone over the first layer; repeat with remaining soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone.
7) Dust with cocoa powder; refrigerate at least 4 hours (overnight ideal).
Note: pasteurized eggs can be used.

Here are the final recipe cards with exact quantities and cooking instructions.

1) Bruschetta (Appetizer)
- Servings: 6
- Yield: ~24 crostini
- Ingredients
  - San Marzano tomatoes: 12
  - Garlic: 6 cloves
  - Fresh basil leaves: 18–24 leaves
  - Baguette: ~1.5 baguettes (practical: 2)
  - Extra-virgin olive oil (in tomato mix): 4.5 tablespoons
  - Extra-virgin olive oil (for brushing bread): 3–4.5 tablespoons
  - Balsamic vinegar: 1.5 tablespoons
  - Salt and black pepper: to taste
  - Balsamic glaze: optional
- Instructions
  - Prepare tomato mix: finely dice tomatoes, mince garlic, chop basil; mix with 4.5 tbsp EVOO, 1.5 tbsp balsamic, salt, pepper.
  - Make crostini: slice baguettes; brush with oil; toast 5–7 minutes at 375–400°F until golden.
  - Assemble: top each crostini with tomato mix; drizzle with extra oil or glaze if desired. Serve within 10–15 minutes.

2) Salmon (Main)
- Servings: 4 fillets
- Weight per fillet: 8 oz
- Ingredients
  - Salmon fillets: 4 x 8 oz
  - Butter: 3 tablespoons
  - Lemon juice: optional
  - Capers: optional
  - Dill: optional
- Cooking instructions
  - Preheat oven to 400°F.
  - Place fillets on a lined sheet. Top each with butter (distributed: total 3 tablespoons).
  - Add lemon juice, capers, and dill as desired.
  - Bake for 14 minutes, until just opaque and flaky.

3) Roasted Asparagus (Side)
- Servings: 4
- Temperature: 425°F
- Time: 15 minutes
- Ingredients
  - 1 bunch asparagus
  - Olive oil: as needed
  - Salt: as needed
  - Black pepper: as needed
- Instructions
  - Preheat oven to 425°F.
  - Toss asparagus with olive oil, salt, and pepper.
  - Roast 15 minutes, until tender and slightly charred.

4) Tiramisu (Dessert)
- Egg yolks: 5 large
- Heavy cream: 2.5 cups
- Ladyfingers: 30
- Method (brief)
  - Whisk 5 yolks with sugar until thick; fold in mascarpone (1 1/3 cups).
  - Whip 2.5 cups heavy cream and fold in.
  - Prepare espresso; mix with coffee liqueur (optional).
  - Quickly dip ladyfingers in espresso; layer with cream; repeat.
  - Refrigerate at least 4 hours; dust with cocoa powder before serving.

Here are the final recipe cards using the latest values. Note: A couple of items (salmon weight per fillet, salmon cooking temperature, and asparagus details) are filled with standard defaults unless you specify otherwise.

1) Bruschetta (serves 6)
Ingredients
- Bread: 1 baguette (≈24 crostini)
- Tomatoes: 4 medium Roma, diced
- Garlic: 6 cloves, minced
- Basil: 10–12 fresh leaves, chopped
- Olive oil: 3–4 Tbsp
- Salt & pepper: to taste
- Optional: balsamic glaze drizzle

Instructions
- Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Slice baguette into crostini; lightly brush with olive oil and toast until golden.
- In a bowl, combine tomatoes, garlic, basil, and 3 Tbsp olive oil; season with salt and pepper.
- Spoon tomato mixture onto crostini. Drizzle with balsamic glaze if desired. Serve.

2) Salmon (weight per fillet: 6 oz / 170 g; serves: 2)
Ingredients
- Salmon fillets: 2 × 6 oz (170 g each)
- Butter: 3 Tbsp
- Salt & pepper: to taste

Cooking: oven method
- Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Pat fillets dry; season with salt and pepper.
- Place on a lined baking sheet; dot with butter.
- Bake 14 minutes. Rest 2 minutes before serving.

3) Asparagus
Ingredients (example)
- Asparagus: 1 bunch (about 1 lb / 450 g)
- Olive oil: 1–2 Tbsp
- Salt & pepper: to taste

Instructions
- Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C). Trim ends; toss with olive oil, salt, and pepper.
- Roast on a sheet pan 12–15 minutes until crisp-tender.

4) Tiramisu (egg yolks, heavy cream, and ladyfingers)
Ingredients
- Egg yolks: 4 large
- Heavy cream: 2.5 cups
- Ladyfingers: 30

Instructions
- In a heatproof bowl, whisk yolks with a small amount of sugar (if using) over simmering water until pale. Let cool.
- Whip heavy cream to soft peaks.
- Gently fold yolk mixture into whipped cream.
- Layer a suitable dish with 15 ladyfingers soaked lightly in coffee (optional), spread a layer of cream, repeat, and finish with cream on top.
- Refrigerate at least 4 hours before serving. Serves about 6–8.

1) Bruschetta (Serves: 6; Prep: ~30–38 minutes)
Ingredients
- 12 San Marzano tomatoes
- 6 garlic cloves
- ~3/4 cup fresh basil, chopped
- 1 1/2 loaves baguette
- 18–24 baguette slices
- ~4.5 tablespoons olive oil for tomato mix
- extra olive oil for brushing bread
- ~1.5 tablespoons balsamic vinegar
- Salt and pepper, to taste

Instructions
1) Mix chopped tomatoes, minced garlic, and chopped basil. Stir in ~4.5 tablespoons olive oil and ~1.5 tablespoons balsamic; season with salt and pepper. Let rest ~10–15 minutes.
2) Slice baguette, brush with extra olive oil, and toast until golden.
3) Spoon tomato mixture onto toasts and serve.

2) Salmon Main (Serves: 4; Weight per fillet: 8 oz; Oven: 400°F)
Ingredients
- 4 salmon fillets (8 oz each)
- 3 tablespoons unsalted butter
- 1 tablespoon lemon juice
- 1 tablespoon capers, drained
- 1 tablespoon fresh dill, chopped
- Salt and pepper, to taste
- Oven preheat: 400°F
- Sear: 2–3 minutes per side
- Bake: 14 minutes
- Rest: 2 minutes
- Total time: ~22 minutes
- Equipment: oven-safe skillet

Instructions
1) Preheat oven to 400°F. Pat salmon dry; season with salt and pepper.
2) In an oven-safe skillet, melt 3 tablespoons butter over medium-high. Sear salmon 2–3 minutes per side.
3) Add lemon juice, capers, and dill to the pan. Transfer to the oven and bake 14 minutes.
4) Rest 2 minutes before serving.

Board Summary (draft)

- Objective
  - Build and operate a secure, scalable API platform with clear rate limits, strong data protection, reliable backups, and defined performance targets.

- Current status (scope implemented)
  - API rate limits: Standard 1,000 requests/min; Premium 5,000 requests/min.
  - Data protection: AES-256 at rest; TLS 1.3 in transit.
  - Backup strategy: full backups daily at 02:00 UTC; incremental every 6 hours; 30-day retention.
  - Performance targets: API p95 < 200 ms; page load < 2 seconds.

- Key metrics and monitoring
  - Enforced quotas at API gateway with 429/Retry-After.
  - Regular encryption checks and TLS configuration validation.
  - Performance dashboards for API latency, error rate, and frontend page load.

- Risks and mitigations
  - Need clarification on quotas scoping: per-key or per-account.
  - Cloud provider/KMS choices and certificate management approach.
  - Dependence on front-end framework choice for performance optimizations.

- Financials and staffing (to be provided)

  - Project lead: [to be filled]
  - Deadline: [to be filled]
  - Frontend framework: [to be filled]

  - Confirm whether quotas are per-key or per-account.
  - Finalize vendor/cloud choices and KMS/certificate management plan.
  - Prepare board slides with detailed milestones and risk mitigation.

Bruschetta al Pomodoro (serves 4 as a starter)
Ingredients:
- Baguette — 1 French baguette, about 12 crostini
- Ripe tomatoes — 4 medium, diced (about 2 cups)
- Fresh basil — 1/4 cup, chopped
- Garlic — 1 clove, minced
- Extra-virgin olive oil — 2 tablespoons (for tomato mixture)
- Salt — 1/2 teaspoon
- Black pepper — to taste
- Balsamic glaze — 1 teaspoon (optional)

Method:
1) Preheat oven to 375°F. Slice baguette into 12 crostini; brush lightly with olive oil. Toast on a sheet pan 5–7 minutes until golden. 
2) In a bowl, combine tomatoes, basil, garlic, olive oil (2 Tbsp), salt, and pepper; toss and let sit 10 minutes.
3) Top each crostini with tomato mixture. Drizzle with balsamic glaze if using. Serve immediately.

Salmon with San Marzano Tomato Topping (serves 4)
Ingredients:
- Salmon fillets — 8 oz each (4 fillets)
- San Marzano tomatoes — 8, chopped
- Olive oil — for tomatoes 2 tablespoons; for brushing salmon 1 tablespoon
- Salt — to taste
- Pepper — to taste
- Asparagus — 1 bunch (about 1 lb)
- Butter — 3 tablespoons, melted (unsalted)

Method:
1) Preheat oven to 400°F.
2) Tomato topping: Chop tomatoes; toss with olive oil (2 Tbsp), salt, and pepper. Roast on a baking sheet 10–12 minutes until softened.
3) Asparagus: Trim ends; toss with olive oil, salt, and pepper; set aside.
4) Salmon: Season with salt and pepper; brush with olive oil (1 Tbsp) and melted butter.
5) On a second sheet pan, roast asparagus at 400°F for 15 minutes.
6) Roast salmon on a separate sheet pan at 400°F for 14 minutes until just cooked.
7) Spoon warm tomatoes over the salmon and serve with the roasted asparagus.

Roasted Asparagus (side dish; serves 4)
Ingredients:
- Asparagus — 1 bunch (about 1 lb)
- Olive oil — 1 tablespoon
- Salt — to taste
- Pepper — to taste

Method:
1) Preheat oven to 400°F.
2) Trim ends; toss with olive oil, salt, and pepper.
3) Roast on a sheet pan 15 minutes until tender-crisp.

Tiramisu (serves 6–8)
Ingredients:
- Egg yolks — 5
- Granulated sugar — 1/2 cup (100 g)
- Mascarpone cheese — 1 cup (240 g)
- Heavy cream — 2.5 cups (600 ml), cold
- Ladyfingers — 30
- Espresso or strong coffee — 1 1/2 cups (360 ml), cooled
- Marsala wine or coffee liqueur — 2–3 Tbsp (optional)
- Cocoa powder — for dusting

Method:
1) Whisk egg yolks with sugar until thick and pale. (If desired, warm gently until sugar dissolves.)
2) Beat in mascarpone until smooth.
3) Whip cream to soft peaks; fold into mascarpone mixture.
4) Combine coffee with optional liqueur in a shallow dish.
5) Dip ladyfingers briefly in coffee and layer in a dish. Spread half the mascarpone mix over them. Repeat with remaining ladyfingers and mascarpone. Finish with a light dusting of cocoa.
6) Refrigerate at least 4 hours or overnight before serving.
